html:
8.8.17  2:55 am   what does classify as a "cluster"?

      a professor told me a 7/13 voiced 7 1 2 3 6 was a cluster, cause of the tone to tone intervals. But it doesn't sound clustery to me
8.8.17  2:53 am   chords where I can use the whole tone scale (besides #11 and b13 chords?)

8.8.17  2:52 am   Hya Bill. can you tell me something(s) that bothered you when you were in a music school?

     something to do with the teachers/teaching methods

8.8.17  2:50 am   i really love the sound of a dimished b13 chord, and also the sound of a dimished maj7 chord. what  other chords in the same family you think i would heavely appreciate it?
love you!
8.8.17  2:47 am   any other cool ways of voicing 7/13 chords?
8.8.17  2:47 am   do you think that rock music sounds powerful cause of the paralel fifths and octaves in power chords? Oh only now i see the irony of my question

8.8.17  2:46 am   Bill, i get that everything has its unique qualities and "flaws", but don't you think some things have more unique qualities than others? ("quality" being something completely personal and intimate)
8.8.17  2:44 am   Do you believe the men and women should have equal rights?
8.8.17  2:44 am   Ok then! So, what comes to your mind when I ask for a "cool" example of a delayed resolution in pop context that is not b2maj7 - 1    ?

8.8.17  2:39 am   I just found all my C's and I discovered that the ones on the left (the lower ones) make a "BLEEEH" sound, and the ones in the middle sound like circles, and the high ones make a "tng" sound and make my face scrunch up.  also they ring out more even when I lift up my finger.  I don't like that.  What's my next step?
8.8.17  2:24 am   do you think there's anything in this world that's irredeemable?

8.8.17  12:52 am   wow!! this is really cool!  i found and counted the Cs, there's 8 Cs on my whole piano! i pressed a lot of the Cs and i noticed they all sound kind of the same, like, i don't know what its called but all of them have similar tone feel to it  i think. but, when i pressed them in order from left to right, each C went some pitch higher than the last C. thats amazing!! i think im ready for the next step, what should i do now?

8.8.17  12:03 am   ive noticed a big difference between the Cs. they all sound "the same" but some are higher the same and some are lower the same. you can even play them at the same time and they cooperate very well. next step please

8.7.17  11:27 pm   When I try to play chords I always play the first inversion of the chord because I'm used to the shape. How do I learn how the 2nd an 3rd inversions because I get confused if my right thumb isn't on the root of the chord. Do good players somehow just really quickly process in their head what position their fingers need to be or did they practice every inversion on every key?
8.7.17  11:25 pm   I'm going to be a new kid and a freshman in high school this year. Do you have any tips to make friends?

8.7.17  11:16 pm   Do you set aside a block of time to work each day (ex. 9am-5pm) since this is like your job? or, since it involves a lot of creativity (which doesn't adhere to a specific timeframe) do you find yourself jumping up with inspiration and going to work right away in lots of random bursts so as to not forget something that could end up being pretty cool? sorry for my english
8.7.17  10:55 pm   It's August, Bill.
8.7.17  10:51 pm   thoughts on towels?
8.7.17  10:35 pm   whenever anyone posts one of your videos on reddit and the topic gets to donating to you there's always someone that says that you sent their paypal money back. why would this be
8.7.17  10:24 pm   why do you think the antibacterial alcohol has the name name as the other alcohol even though they're totally different?
8.7.17  10:16 pm   what is a bandicoot
8.7.17  9:50 pm   do you still have a bad car
8.7.17  9:47 pm   bill!!! important news!!! i pressed notes on my piano and i discovered they make noise when i touch them!!!!!!! holy fuck!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! what do i do now???????

8.7.17  9:34 pm   how are computers random. it doesn't make any sense. they run programs that always do a thing in the same way every time but sometimes the object is to not do the same thing every time
8.7.17  9:31 pm   Have you found a way of making steady progress on your goals without wasting time seeking instant gratification?
8.7.17  8:59 pm   what sort of music can you do at age 2?

8.7.17  8:47 pm   Hey Bill! How do you come up with your harmony in videos like "the high class stuff" "daily schedule" and "how to play a C major scale"?

In the C major scale, you managed to pull an D#m7(no5) -> C#add4 out of nowhere! I love it, and your MLG harmony skills are great!

Please teach me where harmony teachers at Conservatoire in London have failed!
8.7.17  7:28 pm   Can you explain rubber ducks?

8.7.17  7:12 pm   a while ago i think you said that you didn't think you had a video on your channel called "africa"

      when you actually do.

     search it up on your channel, it's pretty good and i hear the creator is really cool!

8.7.17  7:10 pm   bill, about the whole gotta make videos to go with songs.
YES, videos are nice, and your are visualy crazy and memorable, but as you just said, you write and record songs 4x times faster than making a video. so bill, my good man, you have a ton of compositions to actually record for our ears delight, just put the songs on youtube with a spinning record and thats IT. make a full on video for like "singles" if i may out it that way.

i'm sorry about my ranting here, you are already bombarded with questions, requests and all, but i love your songs so much it pains me to see that you think that only videos could help you spread your music, that's why i think that a simple visual on youtube would still get you millions of views/listens, and keep big videos for songs that particularly call you for a complimentary video.

8.7.17  2:57 pm   Y'know that 5-10 minute period just before going to sleep, and just after waking up from sleep? I find that my most adventurous ideas occur during that time period, probably something to do with the brain still being in "dream mode" despite being awake. You ever have occurrences like this?

8.7.17  2:23 pm   Did you know that the chorus of Til The World Ends by Britney Spears is a 4:3 polyrhythm???

      Actually, it's one of the best uses of this polyrhythm I've heard in the sense that it seems so easy and natural (unforced), so much so that it fits in smoothly to a bubblegum-y dance pop song.
